userreviews.userReview: I was given an advance copy of the book for an honest review.I truly love Nicks books. I am a HUGE zombie fan! I literally just finished it. I was so excited to see what goodies Nick had in store for us this time around. And he does not disappoint. This thriller had suspense, action,laugh worthy moments, zombies and so much more. If you loved the first book, you will enjoy this book also. These guys are trying to stay alive and you must read to see if they make it or not! a truly gripping story! I could see this series as movie :-) Great job again Nick! Some quotes I enjoyed:“Looks like someone read ‘Fifty Shades’ before they ate a bullet."

My full Die Trying: A Zombie Apocalypse  review can be found at Audiobook Reviewer.I have never been as tense while listening to a zombie apocalypse audiobook as I was while listening to Die Trying: A Zombie Apocalypse. The first part of this story that hooked me immediately taking place during a violent thunder storm in the pitch black of night, where our military guys were trying to track down a mysterious sound in the air, I really thought that was all the story was going to be for awhile and I would have been totally alright with that. Under constant fear the zombies would hear or find them and ruin their day. Nicholas Ryan bring forth a new type of zombie to my ears, the kind that will eat each other, one was wounded and suddenly the horde stops advancing, moaning turning to growling, and then they converged upon the wounded and tore it to shreds in an all out ravenous feeding frenzy. If that wasn't enough for you Ryan was able to create characters that really spoke to me with their complex histories and a certain mystery surrounding a few of them. My only criticism is that this audiobook was way too short, so many other avenues could have been explored. I highly recommend Die Trying: A Zombie Apocalypse, but only if you are looking for a quick listen that is really fast paced, full of action, tons of suspense and different than your usual zombies. As I said earlier I have already purchased Ground Zero: A Zombie Apocalypse an earlier release because Ryan was able to rouse something in me that few other authors have.Audiobook provided for review by the publisher.

This is my first *real* zombie book. The Death Cure had "cranks" in it, their version of zombies which take longer to go insane but honestly, they seem tame compared to the zombies in this book. And what an excellent first zombie book it was. Rating it only on entertainment value I'd give it 5 stars. I was thoroughly wrapped in the story; it clawed it's way into my mind and wouldn't let go. There were, however, a few things which made me keep the rating at 4 stars (possibly even 4.5). The first being the once or twice the narration head hopped from Mitch to another character. It wasn't much, only one line at a time, but it still stood out to me. I would have liked Mitch's name to be mentioned more. I kind of feel like Mitch is a separate person from the narrator, but I do remember his name :) The second, more plot-wise things would be the pulled tooth (entertaining, and I definitely felt all the emotions of Jed, but I wasn't sure why it needed to be there), the disturbing old man (which was definitely a chilling and gripping read, but again I wasn't sure what purpose it had to the plot. I did like the message it gave about humans though), and finally the wife/daughter shock (because it wasn't hinted at or Mitch didn't show any emotions, it didn't feel real to me. Like something tacked on at the end). However, despite saying all of that, I was hooked. I'll definitely read zombie novels again, and definitely more of Nicholas Ryan's. It scared me (but didn't terrify me in real life - which I was grateful for!), and kept me guessing. The description was amazing, and I loved all the metaphors which really made me understand and feel like I knew what the characters were going through.

[was open, left up to you, I guess, to decide whether the protagonist lived or died. Those types of endings generally annoy me, but it was carried off in a way that I wasn't too aggravated ... quite possibly because I wasn't as connected with the characters as I've been in other - longer - books. I don't usually read zombie books, but this one was very well written from end to end. The characters developed as the story unfolded, and I was kept wrapped in the "what's next" as each page I read and turned. If you like zombie books, this one is sure to grab your attention quickly and it own't let go of you. Highly recommended! :-)

A somewhat typical survival zombie story. While the characters themselves were not that interesting, their interactions, primarily the two brothers in the story, were intriguing. A big problem the book has is that during some of the darkest and most "powerful" moments in the story, the dialogue felt a bit forced and ruined their effect. The story does have a couple of surprising twists and turns that made it unpredictable at times which is definitely a plus.If you are looking for a survival-horror masterpiece then you should look elsewhere. On the other hand, if you're looking for a decent distraction with some OK-action moments, you could do worse than this book.
Kept Me Tense ThroughoutThough we don't get as much zombie action as in some books, the terror of the people came through and it made it much more intense. Great book!!

A great zombie novel. Some surprise twists and a crazy ending. this author is great at painting a picture and getting into the lives of his characters. I would recommend this book to any zombie or horror fan.

4 1/2 star review from Iva Readit for Kota's Book Kollection."I thought nothing could be more terrifying than the undead rising to kill without remorse or reason. But I was wrong."  Mitch, Die Trying by Nicholas Ryan, pg. 129.Nicholas Ryan's Die Trying is an adrenalin pumping ride that has you in it's grip from the first page and well beyond the last. It is extremely well written with intriguing characters and a relentless storyline.When Mitch, his brother Jed, and Harrigan hear the sound of a helicopter overhead after several weeks of nothing during the zombie apocalypse, they know that it may be their only way to find a safe haven for survivors. But as it turns out, Zombies aren't the only things they need to worry about.The story is told from Mitch's perspective, who seems to be the groups unofficial spearhead. To say he and Jed aren't close, is an understatement and the dynamics between the two add to the stress of the situation they find themselves in. Jed is a menacing presence throughout the story. He is the antagonist in the group and is just waiting for the moment he can come out on top. Harrigan fluctuates between being a calm, deep thinking, steady presence, with a strong belief in his bible, to a skittish, nervous fellow, which is totally understandable considering the horror around him.Nicholas Ryan has done a tremendous job in making the reader feel part of the group. We learn the background events as Mitch, Jed and Harrigan do, so there is no loss of pace or slowing of heartbeats as you read along. This gives the book as a whole, a more tangible feel that matches in with the timeline of the story. It is a well developed story with descriptive prose that allows you to smell the fear, and the decaying flesh as well as hear the spray of bullets, and the shuffling stride of the dead woman coming closer. Die Trying by Nicholas Ryan has a true fear factor that doesn't come from the blood and flesh seeking zombies, but from a humans ability to hate, to plot revenge, to be ultimately selfish during a catastrophic event. Nicholas Ryan has done a truly terrific job of writing a horror story where the monsters are not the real monsters at all.Visit Kota's Book Kollection at http://kotasbookkollection.blogspot.c...

I was given a copy of Die Trying for an honest review and honestly, I really liked it! I am not a Walking Dead fan or any type of paranormal reader (any more), more of a romance reader. Yes I kept hoping there was going to be some sort of romantic twist, however there wasn't and I still liked the story.There is one thing I really like in an author and that is description. Nicholas Ryan is an extremely descriptive writer, so much so I felt like I was watching a zombie movie in my head. The book isn't focused solely on zombies, rather a group of people trying to survive as the world crumbles around them.We join Mitch, his brother Jed and another survivor Harrigan twenty-three days into a zombie apocalypse. The men have been holed up in a house, but now that their supplies are dwindling down, they need to make a plan to move. In the distance they hear a helicopter trying to land and wait to see what happens with it.Once the helicopter lands, the men now have to decide if they are going to risk their lives for the life that may or may not be in the helicopter. The zombies are drawn to noise and blood, so upon hearing the landing, they are already on the way.We go on a journey of survival with Mitch, Jed and Harrigan, written so well it feels like we are right there in the streets with them. There are so many obstacles in the way of the precious freedom they are searching for. Besides the chaos going on around them, there is thick tension between Mitch and Jed and at times Jed and Harrigan. Mitch and Jed have family problems that Jed wants solved after it's is all over.I really liked this book, not my usual genre. At. All. However like I mentioned earlier, it is just so well written it kept me interested the whole way through and I couldn't wait to see if they were going to survive. There are a few twists in the plot line that kept things pretty interesting as well. If you are fan of zombies this is for you. If you are a fan of survival stories this is for you. If you are a fan of a well written, action packed books, give Die Trying a chance!

I felt Nicholas Ryan's debut, "Ground Zero," was one of the best zombie novels ever penned, so I was dying to read his sophomore effort and jumped at the opportunity to do so like a starving puma pouncing on helpless prey.So many zombie authors (uh, that's authors who write zombie fiction, not authors who are actually zombies; just wanted to clarify) attempt to nail the winning formula of undead mayhem, high-voltage action, grisly gore, and human drama, but few pull it off with the level of skill that Ryan brings to the ghoul-and-gore game.A couple twists in the 2nd half jacked up the enjoyment ante. Granted, I accurately predicted one of them (not the specifics, but the general gist) while the other one sucker-punched me like an uppercut from a professional boxer catching me right in my blind spot and knocking me for a loop.The zombies sort of play second-fiddle here; while the tale takes place in the aftermath of a zombie apocalypse, the primary threat is completely human, with lies and betrayals and simmering rage festering within the dynamic of the small group of survivors. In other words, the undead might be the primary threat, but they almost pale in comparison to the immediate threat the hero faces from his own enraged--and extremely dangerous--brother. And then there's the crazy old man ... but it's better if you make his acquaintence for yourself.So yes, there is a plethora of zombie-vs.-humans sequences, but greater focus is given to the threat of man's savagery against fellow man.Zombie fiction is both fertile literary ground as well as a barren wasteland. There are plenty of authors doing excellent work in the genre ... and others who seemingly have no brain in their heads judging from the quality of their output. Trust me, Nicholas Ryan is one of the former and nowhere near the latter. It's possible you will read a better zombie novel in 2014 ... but it's more likely you won't.

Really great book. I believe this is the second book in the Ground Zero: A Zombie Apocalypse.Trapped amidst the horror of the zombie apocalypse, three men hear the sound of a helicopter overhead and know it represents their last desperate hope to survive the terror and reach safety. But survival comes at a cost - and the undead hordes that ravage the world are not the only lurking evil the men must face. But for Mitch Logan, his brother, Jed, and their friend, Clinton Harrigan, there is no choice. They must fight to survive - or Die Trying. Mitch and his brother, Jed, are trying to just live another day in the HELL that is the now, the Zombie Apocalypse. They hear a helicopter over head, that seems to be trying to land, due to trouble. The questions are abundant, where is it trying to go, where did it come from, who is aboard it.They make mad, life fearing dashes to get to the helicopter as it is about to descend and crash. There only hope that someone is still alive when they get there. Their only chance for possible survival is to find out where this thing was heading.If I keep going, I am going to give too much away, and that would take away your fun of reading it.Just take my word for it, if you read the first one, then you have to read this one. If you haven't read the first one, well get with it and get reading.It's quick, fast paced and keeps you holding your breath at times when there seems to be no more hope.*a copy of this ebook was provided to me for an honest review, and thank you so much for that, I really enjoyed this one.

I've said this before, and I'm going to say it again...I'm not a huge fan of zombies, but if I'm looking for a bit of flesh eating, brain chomping zombie gore, then Nicholas Ryan is the author I'll turn to. His first book was amazing, so when I got the opportunity to read more from this talented author, I jumped at the chance.Ryan's stories are well developed with plenty of gut-wrenching twists and turns. The suspenseful atmosphere he creates with his plotlines is so thrilling and kept me on the edge of my seat from page one. I felt like I was a part of this story. I felt like I ran alongside the characters as they sought refuge and safety, and to my delightful horror I felt like I was right in the mix of things each time a zombie’s gnashing teeth came a little too close for comfort. But the danger that threatens the characters is not only from the infected undead. Hate, disloyalty and a lack of trust are just some of the factors plaguing this group of survivors. The biggest question was will they survive each other long enough to survive the apocalypse? There were quite a few disturbing moments within this story, and even more frightening than the zombies was the old man, Mitch, encountered on their way to Pentelle. He was a crazed lunatic, and that’s putting it mildly. It definitely upped the creepiness and once again added another layer to this complex story.This was an exciting and enthralling read. A definite must read if you are looking for a great zombie horror that will keep you glued to the pages until the end.

Yay another great zombie read. This was the 2nd book I've read from Mr Ryan and it was another heart stopping read from page one. Nick creates fantastic believable characters introducing Harrison a big burly Christian man and 2 brothers Jed and Mitch who are on the run fighting for survival from humans infected with the jaws virus. With a clever addition in that the dead not only turn into flesh eating zombies, but can hunt their prey successfully too.What makes this book more unique is that it centers around a helicopter crash and the rescue of its occupants. When Harrison and the brothers discover Clive Walker and his daughter Millie alive with a dead pilot, things are definitely not what they seem.But as with any zombie apocalypse it's not just the zombies that you need to fear; with a brilliant parallel twist running through the plot with Jed; who after 10 yrs in one of the toughest prisons is seeking revenge on his brother Mitch, keeping us all gripped.I grew to really like Mitch and Harrigan's character's but felt I wanted more from Millie.This brilliant fast paced creative action-fest is delivered in dramatic detail and plenty of gore to keep every zombieholic happy. Offering clear vision to whats going on so you can almost smell that rotten flesh. This was so fast paced I found myself holding my breath a few times.The ending is just fantastic and didn't see it coming, loved it.A Die Trying 2 would be fab, but its also a great stand alone read too.

The suspense of Die Trying starts with Ryan's detail to word choice in the opening scene: the description of a character, his movement, the sound that he heard, and the first word he spoke. I was hooked, and I had to keep reading.As Mitch, the main character, told the story, I felt like I was walking behind him (thankfully) peering over his shoulder as though I was a part of the action or conversation.The action was amazing! In many of the scenes, out of shock or fear, I found myself yelling out, covering my mouth, and even wanting to cover my eyes.I enjoyed each character and became invested in each one: the devout Christian, the brothers (good v evil), a mystery man and a teenage girl. Lets not forget the old man and his underwear! Ryan does a wonderful job getting the reader invested as each character shares their story and each story will have one sitting on the edge of their seat wondering how it will unfold in the end.The book is fast paced, but the end is really-really intense. The story lines that had me wondering throughout the book came together perfectly and were so unexpected - jaw dropping! The ending is brilliant! By far my favorite book written by Nicholas Ryan. I look forward to future books written by Nicholas Ryan.

Тази е много по-добра от първата. Авторът е успял да избяга от евтините клишета в жанра и от проповядващия си тон, на предишната книга, доставяйки на читателя истинско зомби приключение. С "Умри опитвайки" Райан вече навлезе в групата на любимите ми автори.Описанието на една Америка, заляна от ордите на неживите отново е перфектно, вкарващо те в действието, едва ли не каращо те да повярваш, че апокалипсисът е настъпил. Героите, този път, са като истински хора. Имат своето минало, разбираеми и логични мотиви.Мич, брат му Джет и дебелакът Хариган са се барикадирали от месец в една къща е малко градче. Осъзнават, че няма кой да им помогне. С приключващи хранителни запаси. Те отиват да намерят хеликоптера, който кръжи около града и събира всички зомбита с шумът си, за да разберат от пилота, къде има други оцелели и има ли надежда.Четири звездички и както е тръгнало, сигурно следващата ще е петица. Авторът расте с всяко свое произведение.

Damn, what a read. Nicholas Ryan is getting better and better with every book in his Zombie apocalyps world!You get caught by the story the instant you start with the first page. The point of view while reading gets the reader on eye-level with the characters. The feelings and the situations the characters have to deal with are crawling under your Skin the moment you read them. You nearly feel the fear, panic, pain and thrilling moments Mitch and the little group of survivors in this small peace of the country have to get through. The more i got to the end the more i couldn't lay it down and got hooked and shocked with every twist and further part of the story!! You don't expect if it could get better or worse and when you feel kind of "save" Nicholas Ryan does it again!! Now i so can't wait to read Dead Rage!!

“Die Trying” by Nicholas Ryan A world gone mad, Zombies everywhere and a small handful of humans trying to survive took me into a world that terrified, and amazed me. This is my first book on Zombies and it enthralled me. While trying to survive a small group fight for their survival and the twists and turns along the way held me in suspense as this story unfolded. . I couldn’t put it down. I came away with a mind full of pictures of a world I hope I never see, but a love for a story that took me there. A five star thriller that never lets you come up for a chance to even guess the ending. This is the second book by Nicholas Ryan and he has created a land where Zombies bring the terror you would expect and a simple man becomes a hero in a way that leaves you surprised. Five stars all the way. Bella Doerres

I'm not afraid to say that I wasn't a big zombie fan until The Walking Dead came on tv. Nicholas Ryan's Ground Zero was the first zombie book I ever read and I couldn't wait to read this one. I was not disappointed either! I liked the fact that the cast of characters was not very large, so it's easy to feel emotions for them as you read. Other books I have read have so many characters that I don't feel invested in them too much. It is also good for me that I never knew where Nicholas was going in this book. Just like with movies, I will make a guess as to what I think will happen, and I always love it when I am wrong. I was wrong at pretty much every turn in Die Trying.Nicholas also does a fantastic job of describing the scenes and getting emotions to come alive off the page. With such a great second book, Nicholas Ryan can only go up from here!

Talk about an ending, I wanted more......Nicholas Ryan finished the story where my craving wasn't quite quenched. This was my 2nd Horror/Zombie Novel I've read and Nicholas Ryan's writing truly captivates you. I was griped from the beginning, the graphic description he used whether it me an emotion, a feeling or something that was happening before the characters eyes he described each episode as if you were in the moment.Gripping, Yes/ Thrilling, Yes, scary HELL YES. Do I want more? Um..... Of course. I cannot wait to see what Mr Ryan holds in store for his readers next. I would definitely recommend this book, if you haven't yet read this kind of Genre I would say CHECK OUT NICHOLAS RYAN.

I didn't know what to expect when reading on book on Zombies, but I must say enjoyed the humor, suspense, action. This is my first Zombie book and first from Mr. Ryan. I must say I laughed out loud on a few occasion, I also picture this as a movie!! I love a book that I see in my head as I read. This isn't just about zombies, it is about survival. What would you do to survive a Zombie Apocalypse... me throw my husband to them first...lol embark on the survival of Mitch, Jed and Harrigan as they venture out of safety to take over a helicopter to get the hell out of dodge, or course you have to kick some ass along the way! JUST FYI I enjoyed this book and I am not a huge Zombie fan (as in I have never watched the walking dead) but this is an addicting book for sure!

I understand that there is very little room for expectation of greatness when it comes to the zombie genre, but this book getting an average of 4 on Goodreads is a bit much.This is a poster child for the dangers of "tell, don't show". The antagonist doesn't do much except "grunt," "look with rage in his eyes," and "seethe." The hapless victim "fidgets," "flails," and "looks terrified." The narrator is not a person so much as a device for keeping the plot going - he doesn't have any discerning characteristics, he is weak when it serves the plot, he is the leader of the company when it serves the plot, and he is superhumanly strong when it serves the plot.Two stars because the audiobook narrator was amazing and made this lackluster miss come alive a little bit.

I was given a free copy of Die Trying for a honest review. Ive always been the type of person who reads everything BUT was never really huge into zombies until now !! Nicholas Ryan has made a huge fan out of me. Die trying sucked me right in and I couldn't put it down. It was intense and invigorating, its full of humor, action and suspense. I wasn't left out in the cold wondering what or how to imagine things in my minds eye, it was very imaginable and I was able to close my eye & picture it exactly how it was happening. The story and the characters flowed along so smoothly, all meshing so well together. I would absolutely recommend this book to anyone looking for a thrilling book to read. I will be definitely be looking for more books by Mr. Ryan.

Better than Ground Zero, but not that great. There seem to be overly detailed parts where time slows ridiculously and parts where time seems to just disappear. The end scene doesn't make much sense. Jed is stuck on the road yet it's no problem for an almost dead Mitch and young Jessica to just coast to safety. And I can't take the psychotic old man scene very seriously either. He's very careful of Mitch and then suddenly... not. Also the author describes Jed as being a rather dumb and ignorant brut throughout the story but near the end "cunning", hmmm, an awkwardly forboded and rather boring and obvious nemesis.

I really enjoyed the first one and when the chance came to get a shot at the second for free...Uhm of course I would read it and post a review. I finished it a few days ago and thanks to work have not had time to write a review. But Honestly I think having a few days to reflect on it truly made me enjoy it more. With fast paced action, twists and turns, and of course Zombies how can someone not enjoy this book? There are even laugh out loud moments that make this book that more enjoyable. I could spend hours putting quotes, recap moments without giving them away, but seriously you have to read this series. It's absolutely in my top zombie books.

I seriously don't think I could ever read a book about a zombie apocalypse unless Nicholas Ryan is the author. I read. When I began this book I was thinking that it wouldn't be as good as. Ground Zero. Boy. Was. I. Wrong. Again, zombies are not my thing and the descriptions were gory as hell. I really REALLY liked Ground Zero. But I loved Die Trying. It was action packed, gruesome (especially there's one part I actually had to stop reading cause I was so disturbed), suspenseful. I was at the edge of my seat the whole time. The twists... Oh dear god. Again. So much more than a book about a Zombie apocalypse ... Let's just say the undead weren't even the scariest part.

This has to be one of the scariest books I have ever read! Ryan's descriptions are so vivid, so terrifyingly REAL, I felt as if I was in the story! I could feel the fear, the terror that Mitch was feeling! Great book!!! I completely agree with D.A. Wearmouth when he calls it" a heart stopping zombie thriller"! On several occasions I had to stop reading, put the book down, and catch my breath! My heart was pounding so hard I feared it would jump right out of my chest! I recommend it to anyone who loves horror stories!I can't wait to read more from this amazingly talented author!

This book wasn't great, nor was it horrible. It was just average. Nothing new and improved, and not much action until the last 50 pages. When I'm reading zombie books, I like plenty of action and likeable characters. Heck, even people I really hate would be kind of o.k. The people in this story were flat. I want to be able to connect with the different characters,.but in the end I didn't care who lived or died. Mr. Ryan is a fairly decent author, but he's not very imaginative. From my point of view this makes him average. Nope, I would not recommend this author.

I understand that DJ Molles and Max Brooks are the go to reads for zombie novels, but I'm giving my vote to Nicholas Ryan. This book not only had the shock and horror of the zombie apocalypse, but it had a believable, suspenseful story that grabbed my attention and held it from the first page to the last. I loved the plot twists (and there were several) that crept in when you least expected it. I'm looking forward to Nicholas Ryan's next book and I hope he releases it sooner rather than later.
